Title.evidence: The POWER Trial: A Randomised Controlled Trial on Pre-Operative Endocrine Therapy in Early-Stage Breast Cancer

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were older women with early-stage, ER-positive breast cancer.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received pre-ET, while the control group did not.

Objective.evidence: aims to determine if 3 months of pre-operative endocrine therapy (pre-ET) can inform adjuvant radiation therapy decisions

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in Ki-67 expression, assessed over 3 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using [randomisation method] with allocation concealment by [method].

Number_Randomised.evidence: Thirty-seven participants completed pre-ET and surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Ki-67 expression decreased from 13% in biopsy specimens to 5% in lumpectomy specimens (p<0.001)
